name: Mux
headline: Video infrastructure for developers
description:
Mux is an API-first video platform designed by experts to make world-class video streaming and analytics possible for every development team. Self-optimizing videos take the guesswork out of encodings, delivery, and renditions. Mux makes your video look beautiful on every device, every time.

We offer two products, Mux Video and Mux Data.

Mux Video is a simple API to advanced video streaming. Powered by data and designed by video experts, Mux Video makes beautiful video possible for every development team. Post a video or live stream with a single API call, and watch it within seconds. Mux Video handles the encoding, storage, and delivery. QoE and performance analytics provided by Mux Data is included by default for every Mux video stream.This real-time data is used to create the right renditions for every device and title, resulting in greater reliability and better viewer experiences.

Mux Data is a Quality of Experience analytics platform that measures the performance metrics that actually matter to viewers: rebuffering, startup time, video quality, and errors. Our intuitive dashboard quickly gives users the insight to find issues and make improvements through features like A/B testing, industry-wide scores, alerts, and detailed information about every single video view. The product works out of the box on HTML5, iOS, Android, and major OTT platforms. All data is available via exports and APIs, making it easy to integrate Mux Data into other systems.

founders.name: Adam Brown, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder and CTO.  Previously worked at multiple companies building large scale video streaming, transcoding, and 3D rendering cloud systems.   Liked doing that so much, he decided to do it all again from scratch at Mux.

founders.name: Jon Dahl, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Jon is a former engineer and current startup founder at Mux (video for developers). He built software early in the life of Mux, but accidentally dropped the production database and was made CEO. Before Mux, Jon was co-founder at Zencoder until the company was acquired. He’s proud to say he never dropped the production database at Zencoder.

founders.name: Steve Heffernan, Founder/Head of Product
founders.description: Founder of Zencoder (YC W'10, acquired) and Mux (YC W'16). Creator of the popular web video player Video.js. Father of 2 kids, 3 months apart in age, same biological mother (figure that one out).

founders.name: Matthew McClure, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder and Head of Technology & Community. I'm also a core-contributor to Video.js, the biggest HTML5 video framework, and the organizer of Demuxed, the largest video-focused dev conference/community in the world.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Mux**

Founded in 2016, Mux is a cutting-edge video infrastructure company that aims to empower developers by simplifying the complexities of video streaming and analytics. Part of Y Combinator Batch W16 and located in the San Francisco Bay Area, Mux has grown to a team of about 95 employees under the guidance of Group Partner Michael Seibel.

### Mission
Mux's mission is straightforward: to provide robust video infrastructure for developers. With their API-first approach, they make world-class video streaming and analytics accessible to every development team, enhancing the quality of video experiences across all devices.

### Product Offerings
Mux offers two primary products:

1. **Mux Video**: This product simplifies advanced video streaming through a user-friendly API. Developers can upload videos and live streams with just a single API call, and Mux takes care of the encoding, storage, delivery, and even real-time performance analytics. By self-optimizing video renditions based on real user data, Mux not only enhances reliability but also delivers better viewer experiences.

2. **Mux Data**: This platform focuses on Quality of Experience (QoE) analytics, measuring the key performance metrics that impact viewer satisfaction like buffering, startup times, and video quality. Users can delve into detailed insights with features like A/B testing and alerts, enabling them to pinpoint issues swiftly. Its compatibility stretches across HTML5, iOS, Android, and major OTT platforms, with flexible data export options.

### Why Choose Mux?
Businesses like Shopify, Patreon, and PBS trust Mux to streamline their video functionalities, ensuring seamless live and on-demand video experiences. Mux stands out not just for its technology but also for its commitment to customer support and integration ease, helping teams launch features rapidly and focus on their core products rather than the intricacies of video servers.

### Key Features
- **Easy Integration**: Mux developers can easily pick up with their preferred languages and frameworks (Node.js, Ruby, Python, Go, etc.).
- **Real-Time Analytics**: Comprehensive dashboards provide insights into user engagement, enabling rapid iterations based on viewer data.
- **Scalability**: Mux handles streaming for colossal audiences, trusted to stream billions of minutes daily.

### Conclusion
If you're a developer looking to implement and scale video functionality without the heavy lifting, Mux offers intuitive tools and a deep commitment to quality. Visit [Mux's website](http://mux.com) to start building today—or to see for yourself how Mux can dramatically enhance your video content strategy.
